info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 27 at 3:57PM EDT until June 27 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... East central Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Northern Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Delaware County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 357 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Norristown, or 14 miles northwest of Philadelphia, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Norristown, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Conshohocken, Hatboro, Ambler, Collegeville, Jenkintown, Narberth, Rockledge, Abington, Bryn Athyn, Willow Grove, Germantown, Northeast Philadelphia, Bryn Mawr, Trout Lake and Radnor Township. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 325 and 345. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 29. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 338. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 19. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
